intro: Haemadictyon parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other members commonly referred to as nettles. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
